title: 10/16/23 Senate Study Committee on CON Reform
summary:
Overview:
The Georgia Senate Study Committee on CON Reform held a session at the Memorial Health facility in Savannah, Georgia. The session featured remarks from Senator Ben Watson and a representative from Memorial Health, highlighting the importance of the healthcare industry and the role of the hospital in the local economy.

Key Actions: 
None detected.

Bills Introduced (First Reading):
None detected.

Notable Moments:
- Senator Ben Watson provided an overview of the Savannah area, highlighting its population growth, major industries (manufacturing, ports, military, education), and economic importance.
- A representative from Memorial Health, a major healthcare provider in the region, discussed the hospital's role as a Level 1 trauma center, its children's hospital, and its economic impact as a major employer and provider of charity care.

Votes:
None detected.

Attendance:
Quorum was present, with some committee members joining via Zoom/WebEx.

Adjournment:
The transcript does not provide information on the adjournment or the next session date.
